wikipedia_page.main: Robert Charles Bastard (4 February 1863 – 6 November 1941) succeeded his father Thomas Barnabas Bastard as lessee of Adelaide's "City Baths". When the council upgraded the facility to include the city's only Olympic-size swimming pool, Bastard was retained as a supervisor.

response: *Charles Bastard (1863–1941), South Australian swimming instructor and baths lessee
The last of the series may have been of Charles Bastard, lessee of Adelaide's City Baths. Around 180 of these are listed below:
| 30px || Charles Bastard || Charles Bastard || manager, City Baths ||
